document_data.name: Monifa Diallo
document_data.mainbody:
'''Monifa Diallo''' was a [[human]] commoner from the [[Baldur's Gate/Rivington|Rivington]] district of [[Baldur's Gate]] in the late 15{{th}} century [[DR]].

{{quote|''The cult could raze this place to the ground and those upper city folks wouldn't even blink?''|Monifa Diallo}}
document_data.Description: Monifa was dressed in simple, colorless commoner's garb. She had light brown skin, curly brown hair, and brown eyes. Her ears were pierced with simple, tiny loop earrings.
document_data.History: In the {{YearlinkName|1492}}, the army assembled by the [[Cult of the Absolute]] moved from the [[Moonrise Towers]] in [[Chionthar Valley]] to menace the city of [[Baldur's Gate]], displacing countless refugees in the process along the way. Pressured by the refugee crisis, Baldur's Gate closed the [[Wyrm's Crossing]] bridge, separating Rivington from other parts of the metropolis and turning it into a refugee tent city. Monifa Diallo, who inhabited the district, did not share its' residents' flaring xenophobia and showed disgust with the [[Baldur's Gate/Upper City|Upper City]], believing it did not care for the looming danger and possible deaths of everyone in Rivington.
